intro: Limodorum lusitanicum, commonly known as the Portuguese lily or the lesser lily of the valley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped, white or pale green flowers. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, and its flowers emit a faint, sweet fragrance. Limodorum lusitanicum is often found in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
